\times SU(3)$. $U(1)$ factors are implied to make the rank 8. Note
that $\sum n_I w_I = 0$ mod 3, $\sum n_i^{E_6} w_i = 3, \sum
n_i^{SU_3} w_i = 0$. The shift vectors resulting in the same group
are related by a symmetry. We do not list the
cases with some $w_i$'s of 2, because they do not
provide any new symmetry breaking patterns.
